findings.title: Slippage may occur in the process of issue or redeem EToken
findings.description: The functions EPoolPeriphery#issueForMaxTokenA() and EPoolPeriphery#redeemForMinTokenA() allow users to issue/redeem ETokens using one underlying token, which may result in slippage due to insufficient liquidity in the Uniswap pool.

findings.title: KeeperSubsidy contract can lose its token balances
findings.description: The requestSubsidy() function in KeeperSubsidyPool allows transferring tokens to msg.sender, posing a risk of losing token balances when a specific user or contract is set as beneficiary.

findings.title: Anyone can freely change the tranche's reserve using EPool#rebalance()
findings.description: The EPool#rebalance() function allows anyone to change the reserve of a tranche by entering a value bigger than 1e18 in the fracDelta parameter, rather than rebalancing according to the new rate.
